item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Ralph Ellison
item.description: "Life is to be lived, not controlled; and humanity is won by continuing to play in face of certain defeat." -- Ralph Ellison

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "Earth's crammed with heaven... But only he who sees, takes off his shoes." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "Celebrity is a mask that eats into the face." -- John Updike

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Ovid
item.description: "Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish." -- Ovid

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Lawrence Ferlinghetti
item.description: "Poetry is eternal graffiti written in the heart of everyone." -- Lawrence Ferlinghetti

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Stéphane Mallarmé
item.description: "Everything in the world exists in order to end up as a book." -- Stéphane Mallarmé

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I don't deserve any credit for turning the other cheek as my tongue is always in it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by John Burroughs
item.description: "Do not despise your own place and hour. Every place is under the stars, every place is the center of the world." -- John Burroughs

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "The end of man is knowledge, but there is one thing he can't know. He can't know whether knowledge will save him or kill him. He will be killed, all right, but he can't know whether he is killed because of the knowledge which he has got or because of the knowledge which he hasn't got and which if he had it, would save him." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Google can bring you back 100,000 answers. A librarian can bring you back the right one." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of one’s own self." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Jean de La Fontaine
item.description: "A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it." -- Jean de La Fontaine

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Daring ideas are like chessmen moved forward. They may be beaten, but they may start a winning game." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by John Dryden
item.description: "Bold knaves thrive without one grain of sense, But good men starve for want of impudence." -- John Dryden

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Don't gobblefunk around with words." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Arthur Cleveland Coxe
item.description: "Tis the night—the night Of the grave's delight, And the warlocks are at their play; Ye think that without, The wild winds shout, But no, it is they—it is they!" -- Arthur Cleveland Coxe

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Jose Saramago
item.description: "Words were not given to man in order to conceal his thoughts" -- Jose Saramago

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by The Viking Prayer.
item.description:
"Lo, there do I see my father. Lo, there do I see my mother, and my sisters, and my brothers. Lo, there do I see the line of my people, Back to the beginning!
Lo, they do call to me. They bid me take my place among them, In the halls of Valhalla! Where the brave may live forever!" -- The Viking Prayer.

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by John Gillespie MaGee Jr.
item.description: "Oh, I have slipped the surly bonds of earth, And danced the skies on laughter-silvered wings" -- John Gillespie MaGee Jr.

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "I was not ladylike, nor was I manly. I was something else altogether. There were so many different ways to be beautiful." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Moliere
item.description: "Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit." -- Moliere

item.title: Junebuggin add a quote by Phyllis McGinley
item.description: "A bit of trash now and then is good for the severest reader. It provides the necessary roughage in the literary diet." -- Phyllis McGinley
